definitions.definition: To put out of place; to disarrange.
To move something, or someone, especially to forcibly move people from their homeland.
To supplant, or take the place of something or someone; to substitute.
To replace, on account of being superior to or more suitable than that which is being replaced.
definitions.example: Electronic calculators soon displaced the older mechanical kind.

definitions.definition: (of a floating ship) To have a weight equal to that of the water displaced.
